radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is mildly dilated measuring up to 8 mm with hyperemia. There is mild surrounding fat stranding, particularly at the appendiceal tip. The lung bases are clear. A calcified granuloma is seen in the right lower lobe. No focal lesions in the liver, pancreas, or kidneys. The stomach, duodenum, and small bowel are within normal limits. No obstructive lesions in the colon. No retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymph node enlargement. No ascites or free air.
